info.title: Midgard Public API
info.description: The Midgard Public API queries THORChain and any chains linked via the Bifr√∂st and prepares information about the network to be readily available for public users. The API parses transaction event data from THORChain and stores them in a time-series database to make time-dependent queries easy. Midgard does not hold critical information. To interact with BEPSwap and Asgardex, users should query THORChain directly.

get.description: Swagger/OpenAPI 3.0 specification generated documents.
Returns human and machine readable swagger/openapi specification

200.description: human and machine readable swagger/openapi specification

get.description: Returns an object containing the health response of the API
Returns an array containing details for a set of pools

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter for only pools with this status

get.description: Returns details of the pool: depths, price, 24h volume, APY.

parameters.name: asset
parameters.description: pool name

get.description:
Statistics about the pool. The description of the fields have pointers about the
corresponding v2/history location. Visit the history endpoint for drilldowns.

parameters.name: asset
parameters.description: pool name

parameters.name: period
parameters.description:
Restricts aggregation type fields to the last period only.
Default is 30d.

get.description:
Returns the asset and rune depths and price.
The values report the state at the end of each interval.

History endpoint has two modes:
* With Interval parameter it returns a series of time buckets. From and To dates will
  be rounded to the Interval boundaries.
* Without Interval parameter a single From..To search is performed with exact timestamps.


* Interval: possible values: 5min, hour, day, week, month, quarter, year.
* count: [1..400]. Defines number of intervals. Don't provide if Interval is missing.
* from/to: optional int, unix second.

Possible usages with interval.
* last 10 days: `?interval=day&count=10`
* last 10 days before to: `?interval=day&count=10&to=1608825600`
* next 10 days after from: `?interval=day&count=10&from=1606780800`
* Days between from and to. From defaults to start of chain, to defaults to now.
  Only the first 400 intervals are returned:
  `interval=day&from=1606780800&to=1608825600`

Pagination is possible with from&count and then using the returned meta.endTime as the
From parameter of the next query.

Possible configurations without interval:
* exact search for one time frame: `?from=1606780899&to=1608825600`
* one time frame until now: `?from=1606780899`
* from chain start until now: no query parameters

parameters.name: pool
parameters.description: Return stats for this single pool.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: Interval of calculations

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of intervals to return. Should be between [1..400].

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End time of the query as unix timestamp. If only count is given, defaults to now.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start time of the query as unix timestamp

get.description:
Returns earnings data for the specified interval.

History endpoint has two modes:
* With Interval parameter it returns a series of time buckets. From and To dates will
  be rounded to the Interval boundaries.
* Without Interval parameter a single From..To search is performed with exact timestamps.


* Interval: possible values: 5min, hour, day, week, month, quarter, year.
* count: [1..400]. Defines number of intervals. Don't provide if Interval is missing.
* from/to: optional int, unix second.

Possible usages with interval.
* last 10 days: `?interval=day&count=10`
* last 10 days before to: `?interval=day&count=10&to=1608825600`
* next 10 days after from: `?interval=day&count=10&from=1606780800`
* Days between from and to. From defaults to start of chain, to defaults to now.
  Only the first 400 intervals are returned:
  `interval=day&from=1606780800&to=1608825600`

Pagination is possible with from&count and then using the returned meta.endTime as the
From parameter of the next query.

Possible configurations without interval:
* exact search for one time frame: `?from=1606780899&to=1608825600`
* one time frame until now: `?from=1606780899`
* from chain start until now: no query parameters

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: Interval of calculations

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of intervals to return. Should be between [1..400].

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End time of the query as unix timestamp. If only count is given, defaults to now.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start time of the query as unix timestamp

get.description:
Returns swap count, volume, fees, slip in specified interval.
If pool is not specified returns for all pools

History endpoint has two modes:
* With Interval parameter it returns a series of time buckets. From and To dates will
  be rounded to the Interval boundaries.
* Without Interval parameter a single From..To search is performed with exact timestamps.


* Interval: possible values: 5min, hour, day, week, month, quarter, year.
* count: [1..400]. Defines number of intervals. Don't provide if Interval is missing.
* from/to: optional int, unix second.

Possible usages with interval.
* last 10 days: `?interval=day&count=10`
* last 10 days before to: `?interval=day&count=10&to=1608825600`
* next 10 days after from: `?interval=day&count=10&from=1606780800`
* Days between from and to. From defaults to start of chain, to defaults to now.
  Only the first 400 intervals are returned:
  `interval=day&from=1606780800&to=1608825600`

Pagination is possible with from&count and then using the returned meta.endTime as the
From parameter of the next query.

Possible configurations without interval:
* exact search for one time frame: `?from=1606780899&to=1608825600`
* one time frame until now: `?from=1606780899`
* from chain start until now: no query parameters

parameters.name: pool
parameters.description: Return history given pool. Returns sum of all pools if missing.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: Interval of calculations

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of intervals to return. Should be between [1..400].

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End time of the query as unix timestamp. If only count is given, defaults to now.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start time of the query as unix timestamp

get.description:
Returns total pool depths, total bonds, and total value locked in specified interval.

Total Value Locked = Total Bonds + 2 * Total Pool Depths

History endpoint has two modes:
* With Interval parameter it returns a series of time buckets. From and To dates will
  be rounded to the Interval boundaries.
* Without Interval parameter a single From..To search is performed with exact timestamps.

* Interval: possible values: 5min, hour, day, week, month, quarter, year.
* count: [1..400]. Defines number of intervals. Don't provide if Interval is missing.
* from/to: optional int, unix second.

Possible usages with interval.
* last 10 days: `?interval=day&count=10`
* last 10 days before to: `?interval=day&count=10&to=1608825600`
* next 10 days after from: `?interval=day&count=10&from=1606780800`
* Days between from and to. From defaults to start of chain, to defaults to now.
  Only the first 400 intervals are returned:
  `interval=day&from=1606780800&to=1608825600`

Pagination is possible with from&count and then using the returned meta.endTime as the
From parameter of the next query.

Possible configurations without interval:
* exact search for one time frame: `?from=1606780899&to=1608825600`
* one time frame until now: `?from=1606780899`
* from chain start until now: no query parameters

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: Interval of calculations

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of intervals to return. Should be between [1..400].

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End time of the query as unix timestamp. If only count is given, defaults to now.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start time of the query as unix timestamp

get.description:
Returns withdrawals and deposits for given time interval.
If pool is not specified returns for all pools

History endpoint has two modes:
* With Interval parameter it returns a series of time buckets. From and To dates will
  be rounded to the Interval boundaries.
* Without Interval parameter a single From..To search is performed with exact timestamps.


* Interval: possible values: 5min, hour, day, week, month, quarter, year.
* count: [1..400]. Defines number of intervals. Don't provide if Interval is missing.
* from/to: optional int, unix second.

Possible usages with interval.
* last 10 days: `?interval=day&count=10`
* last 10 days before to: `?interval=day&count=10&to=1608825600`
* next 10 days after from: `?interval=day&count=10&from=1606780800`
* Days between from and to. From defaults to start of chain, to defaults to now.
  Only the first 400 intervals are returned:
  `interval=day&from=1606780800&to=1608825600`

Pagination is possible with from&count and then using the returned meta.endTime as the
From parameter of the next query.

Possible configurations without interval:
* exact search for one time frame: `?from=1606780899&to=1608825600`
* one time frame until now: `?from=1606780899`
* from chain start until now: no query parameters

parameters.name: pool
parameters.description: Return stats for given pool. Returns sum of all pools if missing

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: Interval of calculations

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of intervals to return. Should be between [1..400]

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End time of the query as unix timestamp. If only count is given, defaults to now

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start time of the query as unix timestamp

get.description: Returns a list of Node public keys and adresses.
Returns an object containing Network data

List actions along with their related transactions. An action is generated by one or more
inbound transactions with the intended action set in the transaction memo. The action may result in one
or more outbound transactions. Results are paginated by sets of 50. Filters may be applied
to query actions.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description:
Comma separated list. Address of sender or recipient of any in/out transaction related
to the action.

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: ID of any in/out tx related to the action

parameters.name: asset
parameters.description: Any asset that is part of the action (CHAIN.SYMBOL)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
One or more comma separated unique types of action
(swap, addLiquidity, withdraw, donate, refund, switch)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: number of actions returned, default is 50

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: pagination offset, default is 0

get.description:
Returns an array containing the addresses for all pool members.
Addresses are only shown once. If there's both a RUNE address and an asset address
for a member, only the RUNE address will be shown.

parameters.name: pool
parameters.description: Return only members present in the pool.

get.description: Returns an array of statistics for all the liquidity providers associated with a given member address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address to match liquidity providers. Either a rune or an asset address may be given.

get.description: Returns an array of chains and their addresses associated with the given THORName

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: a THORName

get.summary: Gives a list of THORNames by reverse lookup
get.description: Returns an array of THORNames associated with the given address

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address to match THORNames against.

get.description: Returns an object containing global stats for all pools and all transactions
Inbound addresses will return a list of address , one per chain. The address might change frequently if THORChain has multiple asgards.
Constant values used by THORChain , some of the values can be overrided by mimir
Retrieve lastest block infomation across all chains.
Returns the proxied queue endpoint from thornode
Returns the proxied nodes endpoint from thornode

PoolResponse.description: Object containing details for one pool

SwapHistoryResponse.description: Swap count, volume, fee and slip history

TVLHistoryResponse.description: Total pool depths, total bonds, and total value locked history

NodesResponse.description: Returns an object containing Node public key data

NetworkResponse.description: Returns an object containing Network data

ActionsResponse.description: Returns an array of actions for the given filters.

count.description: Int64, number of results matching the given filters.

MemberDetailsResponse.description: object containing liquidity provider data for a specific member

THORNameDetailsResponse.description: object containing THORName data for a specific name

ReverseTHORNameResponse.description: object containing a list of THORName names for a specific address

database.description: True means healthy, connected to database

inSync.description: True means healthy. False means Midgard is still catching up to the chain

volume24h.description: Int64(e8), the total volume of swaps in the last 24h to and from Rune denoted in Rune.

assetDepth.description: Int64(e8), the amount of Asset in the pool.

runeDepth.description: Int64(e8), the amount of Rune in the pool.

assetPrice.description: Float, price of asset in rune. I.e. rune amount / asset amount.

assetPriceUSD.description: Float, the price of asset in USD (based on the deepest USD pool).

poolAPY.description: Float, Average Percentage Yield: annual return estimated using last weeks income, taking compound interest into account.

status.description: The state of the pool, e.g. Available, Staged.

liquidityUnits.description: Int64, Liquidity Units in the pool.

synthUnits.description: Int64, Synth Units in the pool.

synthSupply.description: Int64, Synth supply in the pool.

units.description: Int64, Total Units (synthUnits + liquidityUnits) in the pool.

status.description: The state of the pool, e.g. Available, Staged

assetPrice.description: Float, price of asset in rune. I.e. rune amount / asset amount

assetPriceUSD.description: Float, the price of asset in USD (based on the deepest USD pool).

assetDepth.description: Int64(e8), the amount of Asset in the pool

runeDepth.description: Int64(e8), the amount of Rune in the pool

synthUnits.description: Int64, Synth Units in the pool

synthSupply.description: Int64, Synth supply in the pool

liquidityUnits.description: Int64, Liquidity Units in the pool

units.description: Int64, Total Units (synthUnits + liquidityUnits) in the pool

uniqueSwapperCount.description: Int64, number of unique adresses that initiated swaps transactions in the period.

toAssetAverageSlip.description: Float64 (Basis points, 0-10000, where 10000=100%), same as history/swaps:toAssetAverageSlip

toRuneAverageSlip.description: Float64 (Basis points, 0-10000, where 10000=100%), same as history/swaps:toRuneAverageSlip

averageSlip.description: Float64 (Basis points, 0-10000, where 10000=100%), same as history/swaps:averageSlip

poolAPY.description: Float, Average Percentage Yield: annual return estimated using last weeks income, taking compound interest into account.

impermanentLossProtectionPaid.description:
Int64(e8), part of the withdrawRuneVolume which was payed because of impermanent loss
protection.

startTime.description: Int64, The beginning time of bucket in unix timestamp

endTime.description: Int64, The end time of bucket in unix timestamp

startTime.description: Int64, The beginning time of bucket in unix timestamp

endTime.description: Int64, The end time of bucket in unix timestamp

assetDepth.description: Int64(e8), the amount of Asset in the pool at the end of the interval

runeDepth.description: Int64(e8), the amount of Rune in the pool at the end of the interval

assetPrice.description: Float, price of asset in rune. I.e. rune amount / asset amount

assetPriceUSD.description: Float, the price of asset in USD (based on the deepest USD pool).

liquidityUnits.description: Int64, Liquidity Units in the pool at the end of the interval

synthUnits.description: Int64, Synth Units in the pool at the end of the interval

synthSupply.description: Int64, Synth supply in the pool at the end of the interval

units.description: Int64, Total Units (synthUnits + liquidityUnits) in the pool at the end of the interval

startTime.description: Int64, The beginning time of interval in unix timestamp

endTime.description: Int64, The end time of interval in unix timestamp

liquidityFees.description: Int64(e8), Total liquidity fees, converted to RUNE, collected during the time interval

blockRewards.description: Int64(e8), Total block rewards emitted during the time interval

earnings.description: Int64(e8), System income generated during the time interval. It is the sum of liquidity fees and block rewards

bondingEarnings.description: Int64(e8), Share of earnings sent to nodes during the time interval

liquidityEarnings.description: Int64(e8), Share of earnings sent to pools during the time interval

avgNodeCount.description: float64, Average amount of active nodes during the time interval

runePriceUSD.description: Float, the price of Rune based on the deepest USD pool at the end of the interval.

pools.description: Earnings data for each pool for the time interval

EarningsHistoryItemPool.description: pool earnings data during the time interval

assetLiquidityFees.description: Int64(e8), liquidity fees collected in the pool's asset

runeLiquidityFees.description: Int64(e8), liquidity fees collected in RUNE

totalLiquidityFeesRune.description: Int64(e8), total liquidity fees (assetFees + runeFees) collected, shown in RUNE

rewards.description:
Int64(e8), RUNE amount sent to (positive) or taken from (negative) the pool as
a result of balancing it's share of system income each block

earnings.description: Int64(e8), total earnings in RUNE (totalLiquidityFees + rewards)

startTime.description: Int64, The beginning time of bucket in unix timestamp

endTime.description: Int64, The end time of bucket in unix timestamp

toAssetCount.description: Int64, count of swaps from rune to asset

toRuneCount.description: Int64, count of swaps from asset to rune

synthMintCount.description: Int64, count of rune to synthetic asset swaps

synthRedeemCount.description: Int64, count of synthetic asset to rune swaps

toAssetVolume.description: Int64(e8), volume of swaps from rune to asset denoted in rune

toRuneVolume.description: Int64(e8), volume of swaps from asset to rune denoted in rune

synthMintVolume.description: Int64(e8), volume of swaps from rune to synthetic asset denoted in rune

synthRedeemVolume.description: Int64(e8), volume of swaps from synthetic asset to rune denoted in rune

totalVolume.description:
Int64(e8),
toAssetVolume + toRuneVolume + synthMintVolume + synthRedeemVolume (denoted in rune)

toAssetFees.description: Int64(e8), the fees collected from swaps from rune to asset (in rune)

toRuneFees.description: Int64(e8), the fees collected from swaps from asset to rune (in rune)

synthMintFees.description: Int64(e8), the fees collected from swaps from rune to synthetic asset (in rune)

synthRedeemFees.description: Int64(e8), the fees collected from swaps from synthetic asset to rune (in rune)

toAssetAverageSlip.description:
Float64 (Basis points, 0-10000, where 10000=100%), the average slip for swaps
from rune to asset.
Big swaps have the same weight as small swaps

toRuneAverageSlip.description:
Float64 (Basis points, 0-10000, where 10000=100%), the average slip for swaps
from asset to rune.
Big swaps have the same weight as small swaps

synthMintAverageSlip.description:
Float64 (Basis points, 0-10000, where 10000=100%), the average slip for swaps
from rune to synthetic asset.
Big swaps have the same weight as small swaps

synthRedeemAverageSlip.description:
Float64 (Basis points, 0-10000, where 10000=100%), the average slip for swaps
from synthetic asset to rune.
Big swaps have the same weight as small swaps

averageSlip.description:
Float64 (Basis points, 0-10000, where 10000=100%), the weighted average (by count)
of toAssetAverageSlip, toRuneAverageSlip, synthMintAverageSlip, synthRedeemAverageSlip.
Big swaps have the same weight as small swaps.

runePriceUSD.description: Float, the price of Rune based on the deepest USD pool at the end of the interval.

startTime.description: Int64, The beginning time of bucket in unix timestamp

endTime.description: Int64, The end time of bucket in unix timestamp

addAssetLiquidityVolume.description:
Int64(e8), total assets deposited during the time interval.
Denoted in Rune using the price at deposit time.

addRuneLiquidityVolume.description: Int64(e8), total Rune deposited during the time interval.

addLiquidityVolume.description:
Int64(e8), total of rune and asset deposits.
Denoted in Rune (using the price at deposit time).

addLiquidityCount.description: Int64, number of deposits during the time interval.

withdrawAssetVolume.description:
Int64(e8), total assets withdrawn during the time interval.
Denoted in Rune using the price at withdraw time.

withdrawRuneVolume.description: Int64(e8), total Rune withdrawn during the time interval.

impermanentLossProtectionPaid.description:
Int64(e8), part of the withdrawRuneVolume which was payed because of impermanent loss
protection.

withdrawVolume.description:
Int64(e8), total of rune and asset withdrawals.
Denoted in Rune (using the price at withdraw time).

withdrawCount.description: Int64, number of withdraw during the time interval.

net.description: Int64(e8), net liquidity changes (withdrawals - deposits) during the time interval

runePriceUSD.description: Float, the price of Rune based on the deepest USD pool at the end of the interval.

startTime.description: Int64, The beginning time of bucket in unix timestamp

endTime.description: Int64, The end time of bucket in unix timestamp

totalValuePooled.description:
Int64(e8) in rune, the total pooled value (both assets and rune) in all of the pools at the end of the interval
Note: this is twice the aggregate Rune depth of all pools.

totalValueBonded.description: Int64(e8), the total amount of bonds (both active and standby) at the end of the interval

totalValueLocked.description:
Int64(e8), total value locked in the chain (in rune)
This equals `totalPooledValue + totalBondedValue`, as it combines the liquidity pools and bonds of the nodes.

runePriceUSD.description: Float, the price of Rune based on the deepest USD pool at the end of the interval.

totalPooledRune.description: Int64(e8), Total Rune pooled in all pools

poolActivationCountdown.description: Int64, the remaining time of pool activation (in blocks)

totalActiveBond.description: Int64(e8), Total bond of active nodes

averageActiveBond.description: Int64(e8), Average bond of active nodes

medianActiveBond.description: Int64(e8), Median bond of active nodes

minimumActiveBond.description: Int64(e8), Minumum bond of active nodes

maximumActiveBond.description: Int64(e8), Maxinum bond of active nodes

totalStandbyBond.description: Int64(e8), Total bond of standby nodes

averageStandbyBond.description: Int64(e8), Average bond of standby nodes

medianStandbyBond.description: Int64(e8), Median bond of standby nodes

minimumStandbyBond.description: Int64(e8), Minumum bond of standby nodes

maximumStandbyBond.description: Int64(e8), Maximum bond of standby nodes

Action.description: action details among with related transactions

status.description: Indicates if the action is completed or if related outbound transactions are still pending.

in.description: Inbound transactions related to the action

out.description: Outbound transactions related to the action

date.description: Int64, nano timestamp of the block at which the action was registered

height.description: Int64, height of the block at which the action was registered

txID.description: Transaction id hash. Some transactions (such as outbound transactions made in the native asset) may have a zero value.

liquidityFee.description: Int64(e8), RUNE amount charged as swap liquidity fee

swapSlip.description: Int64 (Basis points, 0-10000, where 10000=100%), swap slip percentage

swapTarget.description: Int64(e8), minimum output amount specified for the swap

liquidityUnits.description: Int64, amount of liquidity units assigned to the member as result of the liquidity deposit
Int64, amount of liquidity units removed from the member as result of the withdrawal

asymmetry.description: Decimal (-1.0 <=> 1.0), indicates how assymetrical the withdrawal was. 0 means totally symetrical

basisPoints.description: Int64 (Basis points, 0-10000, where 10000=100%), percentage of total pool ownership withdrawn

impermanentLossProtection.description: Int64, additional Rune payed out because of impermanent loss protection

NetworkFees.description: List of network fees associated to an action. One network fee is charged for each outbound transaction

expire.description: Int64, THORChain block height in which THORName expires

entries.description: List details of all chains and their addresses for a given THORName

pools.description: List details of all the liquidity providers identified with the given address

pool.description: Pool rest of the data refers to

runeAddress.description: Rune address used by the member

assetAddress.description: asset address used by the member

liquidityUnits.description: Int64, pool liquidity units that belong the the member

runeAdded.description: Int64(e8), total Rune added to the pool by member

assetAdded.description: Int64(e8), total asset added to the pool by member

runePending.description: Int64(e8), Rune sent but not added yet, it will be added when the asset pair arrives

assetPending.description: Int64(e8), asset sent but not added yet, it will be added when the rune pair arrives

runeWithdrawn.description: Int64(e8), total Rune withdrawn from the pool by member

assetWithdrawn.description: Int64(e8), total asset withdrawn from the pool by member

dateFirstAdded.description: Int64, Unix timestamp for the first time member deposited into the pool

dateLastAdded.description: Int64, Unix timestamp for the last time member deposited into the pool

runeDepth.description: Int64(e8), current total Rune in the pools.

switchedRune.description: Int64(e8), amount of native rune switched from erc20 or BEPSwap rune.

runePriceUSD.description: Float, the price of Rune based on the deepest USD pool.

swapVolume.description: Int64(e8), total volume of swaps denoted in Rune since beginning.

swapCount24h.description: Int64(e8), number of swaps in the last 24h.

swapCount30d.description: Int64, number of swaps in the last 30d.

swapCount.description: Int64, number of swaps since beginning.

toAssetCount.description: Int64, number of swaps from Rune to Asset since beginning.

toRuneCount.description: Int64, number of swaps from Asset to Rune since beginning.

dailyActiveUsers.description: Int64, unique users (addresses) initiating swaps in the last 24 hours.

monthlyActiveUsers.description: Int64, unique users (addresses) initiating swaps in the last 30 days.

uniqueSwapperCount.description: Int64, unique users (addresses) initiating swaps since beginning.

addLiquidityVolume.description: Int64(e8), total of deposits since beginning.

withdrawVolume.description: Int64(e8), total of withdraws since beginning.

impermanentLossProtectionPaid.description: Int64(e8), impermanent loss protection paid out.

addLiquidityCount.description: Int64, number of deposits since beginning.

withdrawCount.description: Int64, number of withdraws since beginning.

halted.description: indicate whether this chain has halted
